column4: Does anyone know how to get Focus to work in a vaguely consistent manner, such that, for example, you can open gvim and click inside another window, and thus both activate that window and bring it to the forefront.
want you want is called click-to-focus and autoraise in the unix world :)
Then why does it work like that sometimes and not other times.
are you on gnome?
yeah
switching between metacity and beryl depending on how infuriated I get
oh, if you're switching between wm's I don't know how you'd get it to be consistent.
not consistent /between/ wm's
why not configure different users for different wms?
Sorry I'm not being clear. I'll use either wm. So long as it is consistent with itself.
see this http://gnomesupport.org/forums/viewtopic.php?t=12034 bug
sry, you are clearly better informed than I am... Have you considered using focus-follows-mouse & no autoraise and just getting used to it? It has many advantages for power users...

but thanks for the suggestion :)
